title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison; Baez received 2 years, with restitution ordered for both.
The scheme involved stealing checks, altering them, and fraudulently depositing them into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teenager previously detained by ICE, invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, a Brazilian immigrant, was held for six days in 2025 after ICE targeted his father; later released on bond.
Gomes' arrest led to community protests and highlighted issues within the U.S. immigration system, as noted by Moulton.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a goal from center ice during Team USA's win against Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Swayman acknowledged losing sight of the puck, attributing it to a 'flash screen' and perfect puck height.
Despite the goal mishap, Team USA easily defeated Denmark, with Swayman making 18 saves in the game.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury could impact the Boston Celtics' playoffs run.
Kevin Durant, who overcame a similar injury, expects Tatum to perform at an All-Star level upon his return.
Carmelo Anthony believes if Tatum returns, it enhances the Celtics' playoff chances by allowing flexibility in lineup integration.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots have $41 million in cap space for the 2026 offseason.
Wide receiver Alec Pierce and offensive tackle Rasheed Walker are top free-agent targets for the Patriots.
Patriots also considering center Connor McGovern and tight end Isaiah Likely for roster improvements.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB's new streaming service, offers MLB.TV as a $134.99 add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can buy MLB.TV for $149.99, which includes a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will be auto-renewed; ESPN Unlimited not required post free trial.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate, indicating progress in his rehab.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. noted Tatum looked like himself in practice, fueling speculation about a return.
Tatum, recovering from an Achilles tear, has no set timetable for return and remains on the team's injury list.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in a 2026 WalletHub analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold bachelor's degrees, highest in the U.S., with 22% having advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Honus Wagner T206 baseball card from the early 1900s is up for auction by Ken Goldin, closing on Feb. 21.
The card, with ties to Massachusetts, was owned by the Shields family for 116 years before being auctioned.
The auction's current bid is $3.9 million, with potential closing price including a fee at $4,758,000.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics, marking his Olympic debut.
Swayman anchored Team USA to win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, enhancing his chances for the Olympic team.
Bruins' defenseman Charlie McAvoy joins Swayman as part of Team USA's lineup against Denmark on Saturday.
